alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains; San Diego County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 02 at 7:30PM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and strong winds possible. Plan on difficult travel conditions, including during the morning commute on Friday. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 14 inches above 6,000 FT, 5 to 10 inches from 5,000 FT to 6,000 FT, and 1 to 5 inches from 4,000 FT to 5,000 FT. Locally higher amounts up to 18 inches possible above 7,000 FT. West to southwest winds with gusts of 30 to 50 mph, strongest along the desert slopes, will be possible. * WHERE...The San Bernardino, Riverside, and San Diego County Mountains. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Two storm systems will impact the region, with the first and more significant system occurring Thursday night through Friday morning. A brief break in precipitation will occur Friday evening before additional snow develops late Friday night through Sunday morning. Snowy and windy conditions with significant reductions in visibility are possible, especially during the morning commute on Friday. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts.
